 )

@Composable
fun textField(email: String, onValueChange: (String) -> Unit) {

 value = email,

inspected `SignUpScreen.kt`. The `TextField` callbacks ignore the new text and re-send the old value, so state never updates. Also, multiple fields are bound to `viewModel.email`, so they all share the same state.

Fix the `onValueChange` lambdas to forward the new text (`it`) and back each field with its own state.

Example with a ViewModel that exposes separate flows:
```kotlin
// Collect distinct states
val fullName by viewModel.fullName.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()
val password by viewModel.password.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()
val email by viewModel.email.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()
val dob by viewModel.dob.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()

// Use the new value (it) in callbacks
HeadingNames("Full Name")
textField(fullName) { viewModel.changeFullName(it) }

HeadingNames("Password")
textField(password) { viewModel.changePassword(it) }

HeadingNames("Email")
textField(email) { viewModel.changeEmail(it) }

HeadingNames("Date of Birth")
textField(dob) { viewModel.changeDob(it) }
```

If your `AuthViewModel` doesn’t yet have `fullName`, `dob`, etc., either:
- add `StateFlow`s plus `changeXxx` methods for each field, or
- temporarily use local state:
```kotlin
var fullName by remember { mutableStateOf("") }
var password by remember { mutableStateOf("") }
var email by remember { mutableStateOf("") }
var dob by remember { mutableStateOf("") }

textField(fullName) { fullName = it }
textField(password) { password = it }
textField(email) { email = it }
textField(dob) { dob = it }
```

Also consider renaming `textField`’s first parameter from `email` to `value` to avoid confusion.

Status: Reviewed the screen and pinpointed the cause. Provided corrected code patterns for forwarding new input and for separating state per field.

- Changed `onValueChange` to use `it` so new input updates state.
- Ensured each field uses its own state instead of all using `viewModel.email`."}]},{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

```kotlin:app/src/main/java/com/teamx/vibecare/auth/utils/AuthViewModel.kt, lines=ALL(1-32)
package com.teamx.vibecare.auth.utils

import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.MutableStateFlow
import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.asStateFlow

class AuthViewModel: ViewModel() {
 private var _email = MutableStateFlow("")
 val email = _email.asStateFlow()
 private var _password = MutableStateFlow("")
 val password = _password.asStateFlow()
 private var _confirmPassword = MutableStateFlow("")
 val confirmPassword = _confirmPassword.asStateFlow()
 private var _passwordVisibility = MutableStateFlow(false)
 val passwordVisibility = _passwordVisibility.asStateFlow()


 fun changeEmail(email: String){
 _email.value = email
 }
 fun changePassword(password: String){
 _password.value = password
 }
 fun changeConfirmPassword(confirmPassword: String){
 _confirmPassword.value = confirmPassword

 }
 fun changePswVisibility(pswVisibility: Boolean){
 _passwordVisibility.value = pswVisibility

 }
}
```

@Composable
fun SignUpScreen(modifier: Modifier, viewModel: AuthViewModel) {
 val fullName by viewModel.email.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()
 val password by viewModel.password.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()
 val email by viewModel.email.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()
 val mobileNumber by viewModel.email.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()
 val dob by viewModel.email.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()




 val passwordVisibility by viewModel.passwordVisibility.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()
 val customFont = FontFamily(
 Font(R.font.league_spartan_semibold, weight = FontWeight.SemiBold)
 )
 Column(
 modifier = modifier
 ) {
 Text(
 text = "New Account",
 modifier
 .fillMaxWidth(),
 textAlign = TextAlign.Center,
 color = Color(AuthUtils.PRIMARY_BLUE),
 fontSize = 28.sp,
 fontFamily = customFont
 )
 Spacer(Modifier.height(24.dp))

 Spacer(Modifier.height(32.dp))

 HeadingNames("Full Name")

 textField(fullName, { viewModel.changeEmail(fullName) } )

 HeadingNames("Password")
 textField(password, { viewModel.changePassword(password) })

 HeadingNames("Email")
 textField(email, { viewModel.changeEmail(email) })

 HeadingNames("Date of Birth")
 textField(dob, { viewModel.changeEmail(dob) })


 TextButton(
 onClick = {},
 modifier = Modifier
 .align(Alignment.CenterHorizontally)
 .padding(end = 26.dp, top = 10.dp)
 ) {
 Text(
 text = "By continuing you agree to our Terms & Conditions",
 fontSize = 12.sp,
 fontFamily = FontFamily(Font(R.font.league_spartan_medium)),
 color = Color(AuthUtils.LIGHT_BLACK),

 )
 }
 Button(
 onClick = {
 //TODO: navigate to home screen
 },
 modifier = Modifier
 .align(Alignment.CenterHorizontally)
 .padding(top = 24.dp)
 .height(55.dp)
 .width(220.dp),
 colors = ButtonDefaults.buttonColors(
 containerColor = Color(AuthUtils.PRIMARY_BLUE)
 )
 ) {
 Text(
 text = "Sign Up",
 fontSize = 24.sp,
 fontFamily = FontFamily(Font(R.font.league_spartan_medium)),
 color = Color.White
 )
 }




 Row(
 modifier = Modifier
 .padding(top = 20.dp)
 .fillMaxWidth(),
 verticalAlignment = Alignment.CenterVertically,
 horizontalArrangement = Arrangement.Center
 ) {
 IconButton( onClick = { /*TODO*/ }) {
 Icon( painter = painterResource(id = R.drawable.ic_launcher_background), contentDescription= null)

 }
 IconButton( onClick = { /*TODO*/ }) {
 Icon( painter = painterResource(id = R.drawable.ic_launcher_background), contentDescription= null)

 }
 IconButton( onClick = { /*TODO*/ }) {
 Icon( painter = painterResource(id = R.drawable.ic_launcher_background), contentDescription= null)

 }
 }

 }

}

@Composable
fun HeadingNames(string: String) {
 Text(
 text = string,
 modifier = Modifier
 .padding(start = 26.dp),
 fontSize = 24.sp,
 fontFamily = FontFamily(Font(R.font.league_spartan_medium)),
 color = Color.Black,
 fontWeight = FontWeight.Bold
 )
}

@Composable
fun textField(email: String, onValueChange: (String) -> Unit) {
 val focusManager = LocalFocusManager.current



 TextField(
 value = email,
 onValueChange = { newValue ->
 onValueChange(newValue)},
 modifier = Modifier
 .fillMaxWidth()
 .padding(start = 24.dp, end = 24.dp, top = 12.dp),
 singleLine = true,
 textStyle = TextStyle.Default.copy(fontSize = 20.sp),
 keyboardActions = KeyboardActions(onDone = { focusManager.clearFocus(true) }),
 shape = RoundedCornerShape(20.dp),
 colors = TextFieldDefaults.colors(
 disabledIndicatorColor = Color.Transparent,
 unfocusedIndicatorColor = Color.Transparent,
 focusedIndicatorColor = Color.Transparent,
 errorIndicatorColor = Color.Transparent,
 unfocusedContainerColor = Color(AuthUtils.LIGHT_BLUE),
 focusedContainerColor = Color(AuthUtils.LIGHT_BLUE),
 focusedTextColor = Color(AuthUtils.PRIMARY_BLUE),
 unfocusedTextColor = Color(AuthUtils.PRIMARY_BLUE)

 )

 )
}

package com.teamx.vibecare.auth.utils

import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.MutableStateFlow
import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.asStateFlow

class AuthViewModel: ViewModel() {
 private var _email = MutableStateFlow("")
 val email = _email.asStateFlow()
 private var _password = MutableStateFlow("")
 val password = _password.asStateFlow()
 private var _confirmPassword = MutableStateFlow("")
 val confirmPassword = _confirmPassword.asStateFlow()
 private var _passwordVisibility = MutableStateFlow(false)
 val passwordVisibility = _passwordVisibility.asStateFlow()


 fun changeEmail(email: String){
 _email.value = email
 }
 fun changePassword(password: String){
 _password.value = password
 }
 fun changeConfirmPassword(confirmPassword: String){
 _confirmPassword.value = confirmPassword

 }
 fun changePswVisibility(pswVisibility: Boolean){
 _passwordVisibility.value = pswVisibility

package com.teamx.vibecare.auth.utils

import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.MutableStateFlow
import kotlinx.coroutines.flow.asStateFlow

class AuthViewModel: ViewModel() {
 private var _email = MutableStateFlow("")
 val email = _email.asStateFlow()
 private var _password = MutableStateFlow("")
 val password = _password.asStateFlow()
 private var _confirmPassword = MutableStateFlow("")
 val confirmPassword = _confirmPassword.asStateFlow()
 private var _passwordVisibility = MutableStateFlow(false)
 val passwordVisibility = _passwordVisibility.asStateFlow()
 private var _fullName = MutableStateFlow("")
 val fullName = _fullName.asStateFlow()
 private var _dob = MutableStateFlow("")
 val dob = _dob.asStateFlow()


 fun changeEmail(email: String){
 _email.value = email
 }
 fun changePassword(password: String){
 _password.value = password
 }
 fun changeConfirmPassword(confirmPassword: String){
 _confirmPassword.value = confirmPassword

 }
 fun changePswVisibility(pswVisibility: Boolean){
 _passwordVisibility.value = pswVisibility

 }
}

isn’t with “mutability” in the ViewModel; it was wiring.

- You were binding multiple fields to `viewModel.email`.
- `onValueChange` was re-sending the old value instead of the new input.
- `fullName` and `dob` weren’t in the ViewModel, so you couldn’t update them.

I added separate state and mutators in `AuthViewModel` and fixed `SignUpScreen` to use them and pass the new text.

Key parts now:
```kotlin
// AuthViewModel.kt
private var _fullName = MutableStateFlow("")
val fullName = _fullName.asStateFlow()
private var _dob = MutableStateFlow("")
val dob = _dob.asStateFlow()

fun changeFullName(fullName: String) { _fullName.value = fullName }
fun changeDob(dob: String) { _dob.value = dob }
```

```kotlin
// SignUpScreen.kt
val fullName by viewModel.fullName.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()
val dob by viewModel.dob.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()

textField(fullName) { viewModel.changeFullName(it) }
textField(password) { viewModel.changePassword(it) }
textField(email) { viewModel.changeEmail(it) }
textField(dob) { viewModel.changeDob(it) }

// textField signature
@Composable
fun textField(value: String, onValueChange: (String) -> Unit) { ... }
```

If you still see errors, do a Clean/Rebuild.

- Added `fullName`/`dob` `StateFlow`s and `changeFullName`/`changeDob` in `AuthViewModel`.
- Updated `SignUpScreen` to bind to the correct flows and forward `it` in `onValueChange`.
- Renamed `textField` param to `value` to avoid confusion."}]},{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

answer: Two wiring bugs.

- You bound almost all fields to the same state (`viewModel.email`), so they fight each other.
- Your `onValueChange` lambdas resend the old value, not the new input.

What to change:

- In `AuthViewModel`, add separate state for `fullName` and `dob` (and any other fields you need), with setters:
```kotlin
private val _fullName = MutableStateFlow("")
val fullName = _fullName.asStateFlow()
fun changeFullName(it: String) { _fullName.value = it }

private val _dob = MutableStateFlow("")
val dob = _dob.asStateFlow()
fun changeDob(it: String) { _dob.value = it }
```

- In `SignUpScreen.kt`, collect the correct flows and forward the new text (`it`) to setters:
```kotlin
val fullName by viewModel.fullName.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()
val password by viewModel.password.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()
val email by viewModel.email.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()
val dob by viewModel.dob.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()

HeadingNames("Full Name")
textField(fullName) { viewModel.changeFullName(it) }

HeadingNames("Password")
textField(password) { viewModel.changePassword(it) }

HeadingNames("Email")
textField(email) { viewModel.changeEmail(it) }

HeadingNames("Date of Birth")
textField(dob) { viewModel.changeDob(it) }
```

- Optional cleanup: rename `textField` param from `email` to `value` to avoid confusion.

If you don’t want to edit the ViewModel yet, use local `remember { mutableStateOf("") }` per field and assign `it` inside each `onValueChange`.

- Each field now has its own state in `AuthViewModel`.
- `SignUpScreen` uses the right flows and passes `it` to update, so typing updates immediately."}]}]}
